total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the coordinates of the two different numbers in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the direction from the first number to the second number.
Q3: Create a line of the first number from its original position to the position of the second number.
Q4: Create a line of the second number perpendicular to the first line, starting from the position of the second number and extending in both directions.
Q5: Identify the position of the third number in the input grid.
Q6: Create a square of the first number around the third number, with the third number at the center.
Q7: Fill the remaining area inside the square with the second number.
Q1: Identify the coordinates of the two different numbers in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the direction from the first number to the second number.
Q3: Draw a line of the first number from its position to the edge of the grid in the direction determined in Q2.
Q4: Draw a line of the second number from its position to the edge of the grid in the opposite direction.
Q5: Draw vertical lines of the second number from its position to the edge of the grid in both up and down directions.
Q6: Draw a box using the first number, with the corners being the intersection points of the lines drawn in Q3, Q4 and Q5.
Q7: Identify the position of the third number in the input grid.
Q8: Draw a line of the first number from the third number's position to the edge of the grid in the direction opposite to the second number.
Q9: Draw a line of the second number from the third number's position to the edge of the grid in the direction of the first number.
Q10: Draw vertical lines of the second number from the third number's position to the edge of the grid in both up and down directions.
Q11: Draw a box using the first number, with the corners being the intersection points of the lines drawn in Q8, Q9 and Q10.
